This, in turn, allows him to assume some manner of superior form - or so he hopes. You have what you came for - it's time to report back to your fellow conspirators.
You, however, recognize it as the site of Dalsida Abbey, which you have recently visited. Whatever Randall could possibly seek to do in that crumbling ruin is unknowable as yet.

A rush of cold air washes over you as your make-shift blanket is torn away from you. It seems the cloth tarp did a better job than previously assumed at trapping heat and making for a relatively effective tent, if not for the hard surface you'd been sleeping on and the bumpy, rough ride that went along with it. The gentle warmth of a morning sun blinds you, and by the time you fully come to, you spot a particularly displeased chameleon gentleman looming over you, muzzle deformed into a scowl.\n\n"Oh no, this will not do," Zosk declares, taking a step back. "Zosk is pleased that his cart was to your liking, {player.name}-{player.species}, but this is squeezing the cat in the dark! What will client-friends think if they see this?"

He points sternly at the street, and that warm, cheeky glint that you had come to recognize from the merchant seems to have made way for annoyance.\n\n"Out," he commands, and you are left with little choice but to sheepishly comply. Gently you rise, finding your muscles more than a little sore from the impromptu overnight massage, but in your desire to not keep the frustrated lizard waiting lest he makes a bigger problem out of this scene, you climb over a crate or two and land on the cobblestone street with your own two paws. The fresh, salty air tastes refreshing after having spent another hour, if not more, wedged under a stifling cloth that was never meant to be used as a blanket.

Shaking his head, Zosk fastens the tarp over the cart again, casting another glare over his shoulder in your general direction, before a spark of amusement flickers in these eyes as they return to his work of hiding any evidence you left behind. You take the time to take stock of your situation as well; it seems you had been deposited in the harbor area of South Finmer, if the familiar-looking docks, unoccupied merchant stalls and monotonous spruce buildings are any indication. Only a few hours have passed since daybreak, it seems, though nevertheless that is a considerable amount of time to spend sprawling on barrels and crates.

"Zosk vaguely remembers telling you it's okay to ride along, so the blame is not entirely on {player.name}-{player.species}. Night is a little blurry. But this is enough fun for one day, yes?" He sighs, casting a glance back at you before focusing on his work, rigging another rope to the tarp as he ties it into a knot.

"What were you doing in there, anyway? No taking things, yes?" he asks dryly, not bothering to keep eye contact as he rigs another rope to the tarp and ties it into a knot. "{player.name}-{player.species} is lucky Zosk keeps a close eye on his cargo, and really just wants to go home at this point. No need to get the town guard involved, yes?" He sighs, shrugging, or perhaps shivering in the autumn chill, tying the tarp down with another knot.

Whether the emerald chameleon had actually processed your response or not, all you get as a reply is a vaguely interested grunt. "Zosk heard there were strange people in Finmer. Not like this though. Get some sleep in a real bed, {player.species}-friend. Better for the back, oho."\n\nWith that comment, the merchant casts a final glance at you as you put a little more distance in between yourself and the carriage, before he hops back onto the bench, and strangely enough, licks his paws. "Time to go home!" he declares to his mount, who could be said to have perked up from its perpetual dissociative state at those words. With his trademark clapping noise, the strange duo sets off again, departing for greener pastures - or perhaps simply better-heated ones.

That leaves you with little more than your own thoughts, along with the buzz of civilization rousing from its nightly slumber. Yes - you had discovered some critically important information during your unwelcome visit to the Maw; there will be two very interested parties awaiting your return. Best make your way to them posthaste.
